isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 15. Inlet Air Heater System

svcprocinfo.para: PurposeTo determine if the Inlet Air Heater system is operating correctly

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

note.para: Inspect for damaged, loose or corroded terminals. Repair if necessary.

step1.para: Install Amp Clamp around feed wire next to element.
Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not start engine.)
Select D_OutputStateTest.ssn in the Open Session File window, select Open to detect possible DTCs.

figure.caption: Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do the KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard Test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard Test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater, then select Run to start the test.

note.para: Voltage should be present for 30 seconds after a 3 second delay. The Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test is limited to two requests per key cycle.

step1.para: After 5 seconds, measure amperage.
Record result on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If amperage is to specification and DTCs were not set, the IAH system is working correctly and is not the starting problem.

If amperage is to specification and DTC 373 was set, check for corroded wires and loose connections on relay terminals. If wires are not corroded and connections are tight, see " IAH (Inlet Air Heater) Circuit
"in the " Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics
" section of the manual, for DTC 373. DTC 373 can be set if there is an open in the IAHD circuit.
If amperage is not to specification and DTCs were not set, do " 15.2. Voltage at Element ."

note.para: DTC 238 can only be set during the KOEO Standard Test.

item.para:
If amperage is 0 and DTC 238 was set, see " IAH (Inlet Air Heater) Circuit
" in the " Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics
" section of this manual. DTC 238 can be set if there is an open or short in the IAH control circuit, open relay ground circuit or a failed relay.
If DTC 373 was set, DTC 238 was not set, and amperage is 0, do " Test 15.5. Relay Operation ."

step1.para: When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

figure.caption: DMM positive lead at element terminal

step1.para: Connect DMM positive lead to IAH element terminal.
Connect DMM negative lead to the alternator ground.
Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not start engine.)

figure.caption: Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do the KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard Test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard Test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater, then select Run to start the test.

note.para: Voltage should be present for 30 seconds after a 3 second delay. The Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test is limited to two requests per key cycle.

step1.para: After 5 seconds, use DMM to measure voltage.
Record result on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If voltage is B+, do " Test 15.3. Resistance of Element ."
If voltage is not B+, do " Test 15.4. Wiring Harness Continuity and Resistance ."

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to OFF

figure.caption: DMM positive lead at element terminal

step1.para: Connect DMM positive lead to IAH element terminal.
Connect DMM negative lead to alternator ground.
Use the DMM to measure resistance (Continuity).
Record result on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If element resistance is greater than 5 ohms, replace the element, following the procedure in the Engine Service Manual and retest.
If element resistance is less than 5 ohms, verify " Test 15.2. Voltage at Element " and do " Test 15.4. Wiring Harness Continuity and Resistance " to check for corrosion and loose connections.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to OFF.

figure.caption: DMM positive lead at element terminal

step1.para: Connect DMM positive lead to IAH element terminal.
Connect DMM negative lead to IAH relay terminal.

note.para: Engines could be wired differently, having wiring harness connectors secured to different relay terminals. Trace wiring harness from element to the IAH relay (the tallest relay), to be sure that the correct relay terminal is being tested.

step1.para: Use DMM to measure resistance.
Record result on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If the wiring resistance is greater than 5 ohms, check for loose connections and terminals. Repair or replace wire between element and relay.

If wiring resistance is less than 5 ohms and DTC 238 was not set, check for corroded wires and loose connections on relay terminals. If wires are not corroded and connections are tight and do " Test 15.5. Relay Operation ."

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

step1.para: Connect DMM positive lead to battery supply terminal (battery to IAH relay).

note.para: Engines could be wired differently, having wiring harness connectors secured to different relay terminals. Trace wiring harness from battery to IAH relay (the tallest relay), to be sure that the correct relay terminal is being tested.

step1.para: Connect DMM negative lead to alternator ground.
Use DMM to measure voltage.
Record result on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If voltage at relay supply terminal is B+, continue with step 5.
If voltage at relay supply terminal is less than B+, repair or replace wire from battery to IAH relay.

step1.para: Connect the DMM positive lead to the IAH relay output terminal.

note.para: Engines could be wired differently, having wiring harness connectors secured to different relay terminals. Trace wiring harness from element to the IAH relay (the tallest relay), to be sure that the correct relay terminal is being tested.

step1.para: Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not start engine.)
Select D_OutputStateTest.ssn in Open Session File window, select Open to detect possible DTCs.

figure.caption: Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do the KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard Test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard Test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater, then select Run to start the test.

note.para: Voltage should be present for 30 seconds after a 3 second delay. The Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test is limited to two requests per key cycle.

step1.para: After 5 seconds, use DMM to measure voltage.
Record result on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If voltage was not detected and DTC 238 was not set, check for corroded wires and loose connections on relay terminals. If terminals are clean and connections were tight, replace the relay.

If voltage was not detected and DTC 238 was set, see " IAH (Inlet Air Heater) Control Circuit
" in the " Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics
" section of this manual. DTC 238 can be set if there is an open or short in the IAH control circuit, open relay ground circuit, or a failed IAH relay coil.

step1.para: When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.
